title: Moo Ping (Grilled Pork Skewers)
description: Moo Ping are Thai-style marinated grilled pork skewers with a balance of sweet, savory and aromatic flavors from garlic, cilantro roots, fish sauce and palm sugar, charred over high heat for smoky edges. Served hot from the grill, they make a perfect street-food snack or casual dinner with sticky rice and fresh vegetables.

ingredients.display_name: pork shoulder, thinly sliced against the grain
cilantro roots (or stems if unavailable), cleaned
ingredients.notes: use roots for authentic flavor; roughly chopped

ingredients.display_name: palm sugar or light brown sugar, grated

ingredients.notes: helps carry marinade and prevent sticking

ingredients.display_name: bamboo skewers, soaked in water 30 minutes
sticky rice or steamed jasmine rice (optional side)

steps.text: Prepare skewers: soak bamboo skewers in water for 30 minutes to prevent burning while grilling.

Make marinade: in a blender or mortar and pestle combine garlic, cilantro roots, fish sauce, soy sauce, palm sugar, vegetable oil, ground pepper and coriander powder if using; blend to a rough paste until sugar dissolves and mixture is homogeneous.

Slice and mix pork: slice pork thinly against the grain to the recommended thickness and place in a bowl; pour marinade over pork and mix thoroughly so each piece is coated. Cover and refrigerate to marinate.
Marinate: refrigerate the pork for at least 120 minutes, or preferably overnight for deepest flavor. Occasionally stir to redistribute marinade.
Skewer the pork: thread 3–4 slices per skewer, folding as needed to make an even thickness along the skewer, leaving small gaps for heat circulation.
Preheat grill or griddle: heat a charcoal grill, gas grill or heavy griddle to medium-high heat (around 200–230°C / 390–450°F) until hot and slightly smoking.

Grill: place skewers on the hot grill and cook, turning frequently and brushing with any reserved marinade or a little oil to prevent drying. Grill until edges char and pork is cooked through, about 3–4 minutes per side depending on thickness; total grilling time approximately 8–10 minutes.
Finish and rest: if using sesame oil, brush lightly on finished skewers for aroma. Rest skewers 2 minutes off the heat to let juices settle.
Serve: transfer to a platter and serve immediately with sticky rice or jasmine rice, cucumber slices and lime wedges. Provide extra dipping sauce if desired.
